page.title: 05Church in Horncliffe
page.content: Horncliffe United Reform Church has its origins in the Evangelical move_ ment in the Church of Scotland in the early part of the nineteenth century. Built in 1853,ten years after the Disruption,as a congregation of the Synod of the Presbyterian Church in England,the preacher at its opening service was thge hymn_writer, the Revd Horatius Bonar,at that time minister of the Free Church of Scotland in Kelso. The building, of local stone,was erected to replace the barn origin_ ally used by the congregation,and the woodwork inside the building was the work of the local carpenter.The manse was first occupied in 1860,having cost Â£317 13s.to built.The hall was erected in 1905,having been part of the Glasgow Exhibition of 1905.
